dsls.markdown:
#Cause & Effect Conditionals ## Next you will add code to check to see how much algae is in the water


- First, the computer checks to see if a condition is true or false. - If it is true, then it will run the blocks inside. - If it is false, then it will not do anything.


## If there is too much algae, then the coral becomes sick








*** ## If there is too little algae, then fish will leave








*** ## If there is just enough algae, then the ecosystem is healthy

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-ecosystems.short_instructions: Simulate your ecosystem falling out of balance with an overgrowth of algae.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-ecosystems.long_instructions: ## Too Much - An Algae Overgrowth! **If there is too much algae, it damages the coral reef** - Find the event when fish touches algae and the eatobject blocks - Add the if too much algae conditional block - Place the change costume block **_inside_** the conditional - Click Run and watch the simulation for an algae overgrowth when the boat catches most of the fish. [][0]

authored_hints.TooMuch: Connect the if too much algae block to the when fish touches algae event.
authored_hints.Costume:
If there's too much algae, the coral will be damaged. 

Use the change costume block next.
authored_hints.BlockInside: Place the change costume block inside the if too much algae block.

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-ecosystems.short_instructions: Add a second conditional to check if there is too little algae left for the fish to eat.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-ecosystems.long_instructions: ## Too Little - They Ate it All! **If there is too little algae to feed the fish, they will leave** - Scroll to the **_end_** of the when fish touches algae program in the workspace - Add a conditional block that will check if too little algae - Place the connected blocks fish stops everything and begins leaving the area **_inside_** the conditional - Click Run and watch for the fish to swim away when they eat most of the algae!

Place the other blocks inside the if too little algae block.

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-ecosystems.short_instructions: Add a third conditional to check if there is the right amount of algae to allow the coral to heal.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-ecosystems.long_instructions: ## Just Right - A Delicate Balance! **If the fish eat enough algae, the coral heals** - Scroll to the **_end_** of the when fish touches algae program in the workspace - Add a conditional block to check if just right algae - Place a change costume behavior **_inside_** the conditional - Click Run and watch the simulation. Does the coral turn healthy when the fish eat some algae? * * * **This marine ecosystem is in a delicate balance. Eventually, the boat will overfish and the sick coral will no longer heal. In Lesson 2, you will code three sustainable fishing practices to help keep the ecosystem healthy.**

dsls.markdown:
## Look at the three ecosystems

One ecosystem is balanced and the other two are imbalanced in different ways. Drag the code to the matching image.

questions.text: Too little algae makes the fish leave. ![](https://images.code.org/c0a28473307b7e9b0e827532d2a6ddda-image-1680212227032.png)

Too much algae makes the coral sick.
![](https://images.code.org/1230fd96832b692b0c8ab88e77957f33-image-1680212254888.png)
Just the right amount of algae allows the sick coral to heal and keeps the fish healthy too. ![](https://images.code.org/3dd061538a7a73285aa0916fdde34e77-image-1680212284869.png)

dsls.title: Match the code to the image

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-ecosystems.short_instructions: Test out the finished simulation. There is a problem! The boat catches so many fish the algae always overgrows. What can we do to fix it?
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-ecosystems.long_instructions: ## Now You're in Control! **To modify the simulation try to:** - Change the number of fish - Change the number of algae - Change how many seconds until the fish & algae regrow - Make other modifications **_Click Finish when you are done._**

-   Change the number of fish
-   Change the number of algae
-   Change how many seconds 
    until the fish & algae regrow
-   Make other modifications

dsls.markdown:
#Save our Seas! ### The ocean has a lot of fish in it, but sometimes people catch too many fish and it can be bad for the ecosystem. In the following levels you will code **three different sustainable fishing practices** to help protect our ocean ecosystems.
###To read more about sustainable solutions for our oceans: Click here

>#Sustainable Fishing Practice #1: >> ##Fishing Zones **Fishing boats can only fish in designated areas. Some areas are off limits for fishing boats so the ecosystem can recover.**

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-ecosystems.short_instructions: The boat is only allowed to fish in one area of the ocean.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-ecosystems.long_instructions: ## Sustainable Practice 1: Fishing Zones **Change the boatâ€™s behavior so it stays in the fishing zone.** - First, run the code to see the boat catch fish everywhere. - Next, under when run, change the background to underwater with zone buoy. - Then, under the new background, add a block so the boat begins fishing only in fishing zone - Click Run to see the boat fish only in one area!

authored_hints.hint2: At the top of the worskpace, connect the background block to when run.
authored_hints.hint3:
Under the background
connect the begins
fishing only in fishing
zone

dsls.markdown:
>#Sustainable Fishing Practice #2: >>##Create a Fishing Season **Set limits on when people can catch fish. When it is not fishing season the ecosystem has time to recover.**
#Save our Seas! ### Overfishing is a problem that can harm marine life ecosystems and the people who rely on them. It's important to practice sustainable fishing to help protect these ecosystems and ensure that fish populations remain healthy.

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-ecosystems.short_instructions: Create a limited time for the boat to catch fish. Stop the boat when it is not fishing season.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-ecosystems.long_instructions: ## Sustainable Practice 2: Fishing Season (Part 1 of 2) **The program begins during 'Fishing Season.' To give the ecosystem time to recover, let's code a "No Fishing" season.** - Under the event Every 4 seconds add a block to set the background to **No Fishing**. - Then, add code to set the boat's behavior to begin no fishing season. - Click Run to see the boat stop fishing when the fishing season ends! _In the next level, you will create a "Fishing" season and the boat will resume fishing._

authored_hints.hint1:
Add the new blocks underneath
the `repeat every 4 seconds` block.
authored_hints.hint2:
Connect the `No Fishing background`
near the top of the workspace under 
the `every 4 seconds` block.
authored_hints.hint3:
Connect `begin no fishing`
under the `no fishing 
background`.

dsls.markdown:
>#Sustainable Fishing Practice #3: >>##Set Fishing Limits **Scientists can help figure out how many fish can be caught without causing harm the ocean. Then the fishermen will know to only catch that many fish.**


#Save our Seas! ### By working together, we can help keep our oceans full of life for generations to come!

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-ecosystems.short_instructions: In this level you need to add the fish into this simulation and give them a realistic size and movement.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-ecosystems.long_instructions: ## Sustainable Practice 3: Fishing Limits (Part 1 of 2) **Code the program to count the number of fish the boat takes.** - Under when run, add a set fishCaught to 0 block to reset the count - At the end of the when boat touches fish event, add a change fishCaught by 1 block - Also connect a boat saysfishCaught - Click Run and watch to see the boat keep track of the fish it catches. _Note: You may have to drag some of the when touches code lower on your screen to fit the new blocks_

authored_hints.hint1:
Before the program has started 0 fish have 
been caught. Use the `set fishCaught to 0` at 
the very top of the workspace.
authored_hints.hint2:
Use the change `fishCaught by 1`
under the catch fish block to count
each fish that the boat catches.
authored_hints.hint3:
Connect the `boat says`
block **underneath** the 
`change fishCaught by 1` 
block

https://studio.code.org/s/csc-ecosystems.short_instructions: In this level, you will remove the boat when it reaches its fishing limit.
https://studio.code.org/s/csc-ecosystems.long_instructions: ## Sustainable Practice 3: Fishing Limits (Part 2 of 2) **Remove the boat when it reaches its fishing limit.** - At the end of the event when boat touches fish, add an if fishCaught = 5 conditional. - Inside the conditional add the removeboat block. - Click Run to make sure the boat goes away after it reaches its limit of 5 fish.

authored_hints.hint1:
Keep connecting blocks 
under the `when boat touches fish` event where you 
ended last level!
authored_hints.hint2: To make the boat stop fishing at 5 fish, connect the `if fishCaught = 5` block at the end of the `when boat touches fish` event.
authored_hints.hint3:
Then add the `remove boat` block to
**inside** the `if fishCaught = 5`block

Drag the code to the matching image.

dsls.markdown:
##**All ecosystems have a _delicately balanced_ food chain** ###The marine ecosystem food chain:
>###1. The sun provides energy for photosynthesis to occur in algae. >###2. The algae is eaten by fish. >###3. Fish are caught and eaten by humans, who use fishing boats with nets.
##**If there is too much or too little of one organism in the food chain, there are effects on the whole ecosystem.**

dsls.description: Each of these ecosystem simulations needs to be adjusted. Choose an ecosystem, run the simulation to observe the problem, and adjust the code to fix it.

csc_ecosystems_rainforest_freeplay_2023.bubble_choice_description:
**Deforestation** has forced more parrots into this area.

Now there are too many! They are eating all of the bugs and causing an overgrowth of ferns.

**Rainforest ecologists, can you help?**
csc_ecosystems_rainforest_freeplay_2023.long_instructions: ##Welcome to the Rainforest **Deforestation has forced more parrots into this area and now there are way too many!** They are eating all of the bugs and causing an overgrowth of ferns. - **Observe:** Click Run to test out the simulation! - **Modify:** Change the **number** of new parrot sprites under when run. - **Record:** Press Run and watch how the simulation has changed. Are there enough bugs to eat the ferns?

authored_hints.hint1:
There are too many parrots! Change the number
of parrots to be less than 8.

csc_ecosystems_desert_2023.bubble_choice_description:
**Off-road vehicle use and mining** are causing many injured rabbits and now they aren't moving!

They should be able to eat the cactus and run from the falcon.

**Desert ecologists, can you help?**
csc_ecosystems_desert_2023.long_instructions: ##Welcome to the Desert **Off-road vehicle use and mining are causing many injured rabbits and now they aren't moving!** They should be able to eat the cactus and run from the falcon. - **Observe:** Click Run to test out the simulation. - **Modify:** Change the speed in the set rabbit speed block under when run in the workspace. - **Record:** Press Run again and watch how the simulation has changed. Are the rabbits searching for food and running from the falcon?

authored_hints.hint1:
The rabbits need to move faster! Change the 
speed of the rabbits to be more than 0.

csc_ecosystems_marsh_2023.bubble_choice_description:
**People are building cities on top of wetlands.**

Too much standing water means mosquitoes are swarming. Bringing in frogs helps control the mosquito population.

**Wetlands ecologists, can you help?**
csc_ecosystems_marsh_2023.long_instructions:
##Welcome to the Wetlands **People are building cities on top of wetlands.** Now there is more standing water and the mosquitos are swarming. Ecologists recommend bringing in more frogs to control the mosquito population.
- **Observe:** Click Run to test out the simulation. - **Modify:** Change the **number** of new frog sprites under when run. - **Record:** Press Run and watch how the simulation has changed. Is there a more balanced amount of mosquitos?

authored_hints.Hint1: We need more frogs! Change the number of frogs to be more than 0.

csc_ecosystems_arctic_2023.bubble_choice_description:
**Climate change** is melting sea ice and making it harder for polar bears to find food.

The bears aren't growing to their full size.

**Polar ecologists, can you help?**
csc_ecosystems_arctic_2023.long_instructions: ##Welcome to the Arctic **Climate change is melting sea ice and making it harder for polar bears to find food.** The bears aren't growing to their full size. - **Observe:** Click Run to test out the simulation! - **Modify:** Change the background to include more ice. Then increase the number on the set polar bear size block under when run. - **Record:** Press Run and watch how the simulation has changed. Is the polar bear's size more realistic?

authored_hints.hint2: Change the background so there is more ice for the polar bear to hunt on.
authored_hints.hint1: The polar bear needs to be bigger! Change its size to be more than 30.

dsls.markdown:
##Share Your Ecosystem Simulation!
###**Ecologists! It's time to share out your research!** ###Explain the following observations you made: >1. Explain the food chain in your ecosystem and how you coded it. >2. Was there too much or too little of an organism? >3. Explain the modifications you made to the simulation. >4. What did you notice after you changed the values?

###**Ready for more coding?** Try out code.org's [Express Course](https://studio.code.org/s/express-2022) to learn more computer science at your own pace.
